feedback:
Excellent application of the DRIVER framework throughout your work. You clearly demonstrated 6 stages: D, R, I, V, E, R2.


STRENGTHS:
- Financial APP: The submission demonstrates a functioning financial application (a Fed-statement translator/chatbot) that processes inputs and produces actionable market signals and sector impacts across multiple examples. Discovery, implementation, and reflection evidence show the tool addresses a real financial need, was executed as a working demo, and provided useful financial insights—meeting the PASS standard.
- Integrate AI: The student clearly integrated an AI language-model chatbot as the core tool, demonstrated it on multiple Fed statements (implementation) and showed concrete, structured outputs (translation, sentiment, probabilities, sector impacts). Reflection indicates the AI materially improved usability and decision support, meeting the criterion for effective AI integration.

criteria.criterion_name: Financial APP: The tool functions as a financial application.
evidence: "I asked if can you create a chatbot that allows you to translate um what the Fed says into possible market trends and movements."
"Must solve a real financial problem. If no one needs this, start over."

"it continually gave us good answers. gives gave us visuals to understand better um and it made it a lot easier um to make these decisions on what I would rather do and where I should um be realizing the sector impact"
criteria.driver_alignment:
Discover: Student explicitly framed a real financial problem to solve ("Must solve a real financial problem").  
Implement: Demonstrated a working tool and live demo workflow ("we're going to take this and copy it...and we're going to see what it shoots out for us") that produces market signals, probabilities, and sector impacts.  
Reflect: Student reported practical value and decision-making improvements from the tool ("made it a lot easier...to make these decisions").
criteria.reasoning: The submission demonstrates a functioning financial application (a Fed-statement translator/chatbot) that processes inputs and produces actionable market signals and sector impacts across multiple examples. Discovery, implementation, and reflection evidence show the tool addresses a real financial need, was executed as a working demo, and provided useful financial insights—meeting the PASS standard.

criteria.criterion_name: Integrate AI: The tool integrates AI capabilities effectively.
evidence: "I asked if can you create a chatbot that allows you to translate um what the Fed says into possible market trends and movements."
"we're going to take this and copy it. Copy this and put it over here. and we're going to see what it shoots out for us"

"it continually gave us good answers. gives gave us visuals to understand better um and it made it a lot easier um to make these decisions on what I would rather do and where I should um be realizing the sector impact"
criteria.driver_alignment:
- Discover: Identified a real financial problem and goal to build an AI-powered Fed translator.
- Implement: Demonstrated execution of an AI chatbot live (copying Fed text into the decoder and showing outputs like translation, hawk/dove meter, probabilities, sector impacts).
- Reflect: Reported that the AI outputs improved understanding and decision-making, indicating added value and effective integration.
criteria.reasoning: The student clearly integrated an AI language-model chatbot as the core tool, demonstrated it on multiple Fed statements (implementation) and showed concrete, structured outputs (translation, sentiment, probabilities, sector impacts). Reflection indicates the AI materially improved usability and decision support, meeting the criterion for effective AI integration.
